These plants are characterized by their striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. Tepuianthus species are typically found in high-altitude cloud forests, where they thrive in cool, moist conditions. The genus is notable for its unique adaptations to the isolated and rugged environments of the tepuis.
